Posts a BBC News summary 6 times a day: every 3 hours from 6am-9pm.

How it works: archive.org watches BBC News TV to record a raw feed of 'chyron' headlines on the lower-third of the screen. This automation extensively cleans and processes the headlines before passing it to OpenAI's GPT-4 for summarisation.

See @tv which posts US news and was the direct inspiration for this service. Unofficial. Not affiliated with BBC.

note:
This profile might be managed by Terraform.

Or, as my "professional" email signature says, "IT expert and mixed media artificer".

Despite being a late millennial, I grew up with a ZX Spectrum and kept using an i486 as my main PC until 2008.

I have a degree in electrical engineering, majoring in industrial and microelectronics, but somehow ended up building massively distributed computer systems. I helped to roll out HTTP/2 at a Google competitor, then eventually helped to ensure that Instagram deletes the user data that users asked to delete, and until recently was a site reliability engineer for a big chunk of iCloud. I learned a lot during my long-ish career, and this knowledge makes me sad and keeps me up at night sometimes.

I never post here in a "working adult" capacity, and wouldn't dare to speak for my current or past employers. Instead, I engage in playful shitpost and creative exploration of technologies that have no commercial applications.

Feel free to DM me, I'll try to reply to all!

生活化報導香港好玩科技情報！不再是沉悶數據及跑分
unwire.hk 是本港著名免費生活科技資訊網站，為讀者追踪報導科技在生活不同範疇上的最新應用，並探討其影響，部份內容包括: 電子產品測試、時事話題以及名人專訪等。讀者年齡集中20 到 40 歲，行業廣泛，當中包括在學青年，同時亦不乏管理階層。現時，unwire.hk 平均每月獨立瀏覽人次達 250萬以上，Facebook 專頁粉絲人數超過60 萬。同時我們亦會把期為讀者舉辦不同類型的活動，如新機試玩派對及行業領袖交流會等，跟讀者多作交流外，同時亦希望為他們創造更多發掘新知識及獲得啓發的平台。近年，unwire.hk 更為推動本地初創企業不遺餘力，全方位實踐 unwire.hk 『玩生活，樂科技』的宗旨。
由 BMEDIA Limited 進行營運

fields.name: Group Rules
fields.value:
1. Be respectful: Members should treat each other with respect and kindness. Harassment, hate speech, and personal attacks will not be tolerated.

2. Keep it safe: The group should be a safe space for everyone. Members should not post content that is violent, sexually explicit, or otherwise inappropriate.

3. Stay on topic: The group should have a clear focus, and members should keep their posts relevant to the topic of the group. Off-topic posts should be avoided.

4. No spam: Members should not use the group to promote their own products, services, or websites. Spamming the group with irrelevant content is not allowed.

5. Be mindful of others: Members should be aware of how their posts might affect others in the group. Triggering or upsetting content should be avoided.

6. Follow Mastodon's rules: Members should follow Mastodon's Terms of Service and Community Guidelines. Any violations will be taken seriously and could result in removal from the group.

General Discussion for politics in the UK.
Please don’t post to both !uk_politics@feddit.uk and !unitedkingdom@feddit.uk .
Pick the most appropriate, and put it there.

Posts should be related to UK-centric politics, and should be either a link to a reputable news source for news, or a text post on this community.

Opinion pieces are also allowed, provided they are not misleading/misrepresented/drivel, and have proper sources.

If you think “reputable news source” needs some definition, by all means start a meta thread. (These things should be publicly discussed)

Posts should be manually submitted, not by bot. Link titles should not be editorialised.

Disappointing comments will generally be left to fester in ratio, outright horrible comments will be removed.
Message the mods if you feel something really should be removed, or if a user seems to have a pattern of awful comments.

The one and only #VR community on the Fediverse!

Rules:

  • Only post VR-/AR-related content!
  • Please communicate in English.
  • Be kind, respectful and follow "Feddit.de"'s instance rules. See below.
  • Do not discuss politics! It's okay to criticize certain companies, actions and ideas. Make sure, however, that it's all about XR.
  • Do not advertise excessively. Do not spam. Keep your posts relevant.
  • No trading, begging, giveaways and fundraising allowed!
  • Piracy can be a great thing. But please keep it legal. Don't post links to pirated files.
